result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel M. Denton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel M. Denton in court with attorney David V. Penn.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 13cf188, 13tr2571, 13tr2748,14cf131 and 14cf225 (Initial).  In case 13cf188 - State moves to amend count 1 to 941.01(1) - Negligent Operation of a motor vehicle not on a Hwy - MA and dismiss count 2 - Granted.  State moves to dismiss 13tr2571 - Granted.  Case 13tr2748 - Refusal is deemed reasonable.  Case 14cf31 - State moves to amend to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping 946.49(1)(a) - Granted.  Case 14cf225 - In receipt of complaint - State moves to amend to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping - 946.49(1)(a) - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bednar/Penn/Court statement to sentencing
Court Sentence

Jail 40 days w/ Huber for all purposes - To commence on/before 11-14-14 at 8 am - Court will allow day for day credit for attendance in relapse program

Adj:  03:38 pm

02:10 pm - Defendant Daniel M. Denton in court with attorney David V Penn.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf31 (AIA), 13cf188, 13tr2571 and 13tr2748.  In 14cf31 - Penn in receipt of complaint, waive reading.  Prelim time limits waived.  Penn requests jury trial date in 13cf188 for 5/9/13 be adjourned.  Penn needs to do some additional investigation at scene and cannot complete while ground remains snow covered.  Court will take May 9th jury trial off calendar in 13cf188 and sets cases for pretrial conference.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
no intoxicants in any amount in any location, no taverns

01:34 pm - MHB for PFO.  Defendant Daniel M. Denton in court, via video, in custody.  Susan J Sommer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states Penn represents in underlying case.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Sommer statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
